{"step_by_step_thinking": "Neonatal Tetanus is caused by Clostridium tetani, which is mentioned in Document [31]. Refusal to feed is a common initial symptom, as stated in Document [13]. The mortality rate of Neonatal Tetanus is high, ranging from 50-75%, as mentioned in Document [0]. However, Neonatal Tetanus usually does not occur in the first 2 days of life. As per Document [29], it is defined as an illness occurring in a child who has the normal ability to suck and cry in the first 2 days of life but loses this ability between days 3 and 28 of life.", "answer_choice": "C"}
